DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Medication For Pain Relief Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to whether or not intravenous medication for pain relief was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Medication For Pain Relief Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Administration within or into a vein or veins._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._The reason of something._A lessening of pain following an intervention._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Administration within or into a vein or veins.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: The reason of something.:A lessening of pain following an intervention.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A lessening of pain following an intervention.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
